pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.3: According to the sub-commentaries the whole hand refers to the five fingers: _pañcaṅguliṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ_, “it is said with regard to the five fingers,” [](Sp-yoj.1.618). The same point is made at [](Kkh-ṭ): “The whole hand means all the fingers,” _sakalaṃ hatthanti sakalā aṅguliyo_.
